subject: History
title: The Russian Revolution
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Russian Revolution.

hook.text: In 1917, Russia overthrew a 300-year-old dynasty and tried to build a workers' paradise. It became a nightmare.

buildup.text: World War I, famine, and an incompetent tsar pushed Russia to the breaking point. Bread riots lit the fuse.

discovery.text: Lenin's Bolsheviks seized power in October 1917, promising 'Peace, Land, and Bread' to the masses.

twist.text: A brutal civil war followed. Lenin created the secret police and banned all opposition parties.

climax.text: Stalin inherited the revolution and turned it into a totalitarian state. Millions died in purges and famines.

punchline.text: The revolution against tyranny became tyranny itself.

quiz.question: What slogan did Lenin's Bolsheviks use to gain popular support?
